column1: Novoalexandrovsk (Russian: Новоалекса́ндровск) is a town and the administrative center of Novoalexandrovsky District in Stavropol Krai
column3: located on the bank of the Rasshevatka River
column5: the administrative center of the krai. Population: 26

column1: It was founded in 1804 by settlers from Central Russia as the village of Novo-Alexandrovskoye (Но́во-Алекса́ндровское). In 1832
column2: it was transformed into the Cossack stanitsa of Novoalexandrovskaya (Новоалекса́ндровская). It was granted town status and renamed Novoalexandrovsk in 1971.

column1: Within the framework of administrative divisions
column2: Novoalexandrovsk serves as the administrative center of Novoalexandrovsky District. As an administrative division
column4: together with the khutor of Verny
column5: incorporated within Novoalexandrovsky District as the Town of Novoalexandrovsk. As a municipal division
column6: the Town of Novoalexandrovsk is incorporated within Novoalexandrovsky Municipal District as Novoalexandrovsk Urban Settlement.
